meanings.definition: To renounce or relinquish a throne, power, responsibility, or right.
meanings.sent1: The king abdicates his throne to his son.
meanings.sent2: She abdicates her power to make decisions to her team.
meanings.sent3: The cat abdicates its responsibility to catch mice and just sleeps all day.
meanings.sent4: The sun abdicates its reign to the moon every night.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the hero abdicates his right to the treasure for the greater good.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill or undertake a responsibility or duty.
meanings.sent1: He abdicates his duty to water the plants, causing them to wither.
meanings.sent2: The student abdicates his responsibility to study and fails the exam.
meanings.sent3: The robot abdicates its duty to clean the house and starts dancing instead.
meanings.sent4: The clouds abdicate their duty to provide shade, letting the sun shine brightly.
meanings.sent5: The soldier abdicates his duty to protect the castle, leading to its capture.
